tophersmith.security.headers.csp

Class ContentSecurityPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • tophersmith.security.headers.csp.ContentSecurityPolicy

  • public class ContentSecurityPolicy
extends Object
    A Content Security Policy defines several directives that indicate from where certain kinds of content may be loaded. This is sent via a declarative list in an HTTP Response header. A Browser's User-Agent takes this policy into consideration when loading resources into the browser. This protects the browser from a wide array of content injection vulnerabilities. The CSP is a "Defense-in-Depth" strategy component and should be used alongside other defenses, such as input validation.

    Example:
    ContentSecurityPolicy csp = new ContentSecurityPolicy();
    DefaultSrcDirective defaultDir = new DefaultSrcDirective().addSelf();
    ScriptSrcDirective scriptDir = new ScriptSrcDirective().addSelf().addUnsafeInline().addUnsafeEval();
    csp.addDirective(defaultDir).addDirective(scriptDir);
    csp.build();
    The build method would return default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval'
    Author:
    Chris Smith

    • Method Detail

      • addDirective

        public ContentSecurityPolicy addDirective(AbstractCSPDirective directive)
        adds a new CSPDirective to this policy. This directive replaces any previously defined directive of the same type
        Parameters:
        directive - a new directive to be attached to this policy
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • getDirective

        public AbstractCSPDirective getDirective(String directiveName)
        Retrieve a CSP Directive by name
        Parameters:
        directiveName - suggested to use the AbstractCSPDirective's NAME value
        Returns:
        a directive denoted by the supplied directiveName or null

      • reduce

        public ContentSecurityPolicy reduce()
        Attempts to reduce a policy to its most compressed version. This transformation occurs in place, therefore post-compression some data may be lost
        Returns:
        a reference to this object

      • resetValidationReport

        public void resetValidationReport()
        clears the validation report attached to this policy so that validation may be re-run

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        For each directive defined on this policy, attempt to validate the directive, filling the validation report with any validation issues discovered
        Returns:
        true if no validation errors occurred.

      • getValidationErrorReports

        public List<String> getValidationErrorReports()
        get the list of errors attached to the validation report
        Returns:
        a List of errors encountered during validation

      • getValidationWarningReports

        public List<String> getValidationWarningReports()
        get the list of warnings attached to the validation report
        Returns:
        a List of warnings encountered during validation

      • build

        public String build()
        Construct a String representation of the policy using the defined CSP directives
        Returns:
        a String representation of this policy
